Ingredients: Coconut oil
How_to: Massage a few drops of coconut oil under the eyes to get rid of under eye darkness circles. Do this every day before sleeping

Ingredients: Almond oil and Honey
How_to: Mix almond oil with honey and apply it each night to prevent dark circles and eye bags.

Ingredients: Rose water
How_to: Drench a cotton pad in pure rose water and then place it on your eyes for 15 minutes.

Treatment pack: Milk and Baking Soda Eye Mask
Ingredients: 4 tablespoons of fresh whole milk, 2 tablespoons of baking soda
How_to: Mix well to make a smooth mixture which becomes a creamy mixture. Place it in the fridge and apply it on your eyes when chilled. Let it stay for 30 minutes and then wash it off with cold water.

Ingredients: Used tea bags
How_to: Put some used tea bags in the refrigerator or wet them, use them, and then take those bags and put them in the fridge for 5 to 10 minutes. Then place them on your eyes for 10-15 minutes.

Ingredients: Cucumber
How_to: Grate the cucumber and keep in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Then spread it evenly on your eyes and keep it for 30 minutes. Now, wash it off with cold water.

Ingredients: 2 tablespoons of honey, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon powder
How_to: Mix the honey and cinnamon powder until you get a smooth paste. Apply the mixture to your face, avoiding the eye area. Leave it on for about 10-15 minutes before rinsing off with warm water.

Ingredients: 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 2 tablespoons of plain yogurt.
How_to: Combine the turmeric powder with the yogurt to form a paste. Apply to the face and leave for about 20 minutes. Rinse with cool water.

Treatment pack: Tea Tree Oil and Aloe Vera Pack
Ingredients: A few drops of tea tree oil, 2 tablespoons of aloe vera gel
How_to: Mix the tea tree oil with the aloe vera gel. Apply the blend to the affected areas or the entire face and leave it on for about 20 minutes before rinsing.

Ingredients: 1 cooled green tea bag, 2 tablespoons of honey
How_to: Steep the green tea and let it cool. Cut open the tea bag and mix the leaves with honey to create a paste. Apply to your face for 15-20 minutes before rinsing off.

Ingredients: 3 tablespoons of ground oatmeal, 1 tablespoon of honey, a splash of water
How_to: Mix the ground oatmeal with honey and enough water to form a paste. Apply to the face for 15-20 minutes before washing off with warm water.

Treatment pack: Activated Charcoal and Aloe Vera Pack
Ingredients: 1 capsule of activated charcoal, a generous amount of aloe vera gel
How_to: Open the activated charcoal capsule and mix the powder with aloe vera gel to create a paste. Apply to the face, let it sit for 10-15 minutes, and then rinse off.

Treatment pack: Aloe Vera and Turmeric Face Pack
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon of aloe vera gel, a teaspoon of turmeric powder
How_to: Mix the aloe vera gel with turmeric powder until you have a consistent paste. Apply to the face, leave it on for 20 minutes, then rinse with cool water.

Ingredients: 2 tablespoons of honey, 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice
How_to: Combine the honey and lemon juice. Apply the mixture to your face, leave for 15-20 minutes, then rinse with warm water.

Ingredients: 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 2 tablespoons of plain yogurt.
How_to: Blend the turmeric powder with honey to create a paste. Apply to the face for 15-20 minutes before washing off.

Ingredients: Fresh lime, Honey
How_to: squeeze some fresh lime and mix it with honey. You can add some sugar, prefer the fine one, and scrub your face using the paste. You can also keep the mixture on your face for 20-30 minutes and then wash it off.

Ingredients: Gram flour(Besan), Turmeric, Yogurt
How_to: You can make a paste of gram flour, turmeric, yogurt and apply it on your skin. You can make paste in raw milk or you can even use water. Now, let the paste sit on skin for 15 minutes and gently scrub while washing it off.

Ingredients: 4-5 cubes of ripe papaya, Watermelon,  Potato, Tomato, cucumber
How_to: Take 4-5 cubes of ripe papaya, watermelon, potato, tomato, cucumber and blend. Keep the paste in the refrigerator for 15 minutes and then apply it on your skin. Keep rubbing your face with the paste until it gets absorbed in your skin.

Ingredients: Soak lentil, commonly known as Masoor dal, in raw milk overnight
How_to: Blend the soaked lentils with turmeric to make a thick paste. Apply the paste on your skin and wait till it gets dry. Make sure you scrub your face gently while washing it off.

Ingredients: Coffee powder, Coconut oil, Sugar
How_to: Make a thick paste of coffee powder, coconut oil, and sugar and scrub it for 10 minutes. Let it sit on the skin for 20 more minutes and then wash it off gently.

Ingredients: Hot water, Oats, yogurt, Honey
How_to: Combine 1/2 cup(120ml) of hot water with 1/3 cup(43g) of oatmeal in a bowl. Let the mixture sit for 2 to 3 minutes, then stir in 2 tablespoons (30ml) of plain yogurt and 2 tablespoons (30ml) of honey. Smooth the mask onto your face, then let it sit for about 15 minutes. Before you rinse this mask off, put a strainer in your sink to catch all the oats and prevent a clog. For extra exfoliation, scrub the oatmeal mask on your skin for about 30 seconds before letting it sit.

Ingredients: Avocado, plain organic yogurt,1  tsp (4.9 mL) of raw honey
How_to: Cut an avocado in half and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. Mix it with 1 tsp (4.9mL) of plain organic yogurt and 1 tsp (4.9mL) of raw honey. Mash the mixture until it's smooth, then gently dab it all over your clean face. Allow the mask to sit on your skin for 15 to 20 minutes so the omega fatty acids in the avocado and olive oil have time to penetrate.

Ingredients: Banana
How_to: Peel a banana and cut it in half, then mash one half with a fork. Spread the mashed banana all over your face and down your neck, then let it sit for 15 to 20 minutes before rinsing.If the mask is too thick, you can mix in 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of milk to thin it out a bit.

Ingredients: Fat-free Greek yogurt, 1 tbsp (15 mL) of raw honey, 1/4   (59 mL) of canned pumpkin, and 1 tbsp (17 g) of ground flax seed
How_to:
Combine 1/4  cup (59 mL) of fat-free Greek yogurt, 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of raw honey, 1/4  (59 mL) of canned pumpkin, and 1 tbsp (17 g) of ground flax seed. Mix the ingredients up until they are smooth, then spread the mask all over your face. Leave it on for about 10 minutes before rinsing with warm water.
Pumpkin does have a tendency to stain carpet and clothing, so do this in the bathroom or over the sink to avoid potential disasters.
If you’re having trouble getting the mask off your skin, use a microfiber cloth to scrub it off.

Ingredients: Mash 5 fresh strawberries, 1/2 tbsp (7.4 mL) of plain yogurt, and 2 teaspoons (9.9 mL) of honey
How_to:
In a small bowl, mash 5 fresh strawberries, 1/2  tbsp (7.4 mL) of plain yogurt, and 2 teaspoons (9.9 mL) of honey. Keep mashing with a fork until the mixture is smooth, then spread it onto your face.
Keep the mask on for approximately 20 minutes so you can get the maximum benefits.

Ingredients: Grab an egg and separate the yolk
How_to:
Grab an egg and separate the yolk, then throw the egg whites away. Beat the yolk and add in a dash of cinnamon, then spread the mixture all over your face. Let it sit for about 30 minutes before rinsing with warm water.
Egg whites are great for oily skin, but aren’t so good for dry skin. Stick to using the yolks only for a hydrating mask.
To make your mask a little creamier, add in a few drops of honey.

Ingredients: Mix the juice from 1/4 of an orange with 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of plain yogurt and 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of aloe
How_to:
In a small bowl, mix the juice from 1/4 of an orange with 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of plain yogurt and 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of aloe. Use a foundation brush to smooth the mixture onto your face, then let it sit for about 15 minutes.
This mask can also help reduce pigmentation and redness on your skin, so it’s a win-win!
If you have any sun damage on your face, this is a great mask to try.

Ingredients: Mix together 1 tbsp (17 g) of chickpea flour with a pinch of turmeric powder.
How_to:
In a small bowl, mix together 1 tbsp (17 g) of chickpea flour with a pinch of turmeric powder. Add 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of water, then stir the ingredients together until they are smooth. Once your mixture is nice and thick, spread it onto your face and leave it there for about 15 minutes.
Turmeric is a tried and true skincare ingredient. It can help reduce inflammation, brighten up dark spots, prevent breakouts, and heal dry skin. It is a great ingredient to keep on hand for whenever you need it!

Ingredients: Fresh Coffee grounds, 1/2 tbsp (8.5 g) of red or green clay, 1 tbsp (15 mL) of coconut oil, and a splash of water
How_to:
Mix 1 to 2 tbsp (17 to 34 g) of fresh coffee grounds, 1/2 tbsp (8.5 g) of red or green clay, 1 tbsp (15 mL) of coconut oil, and a splash of water. Use a fork to combine your mixture until it is smooth, then spread it onto your skin and leave it for about 15 minutes.
If you are prone to breakouts, you might not want to put coconut oil on your face (it has a tendency to clog your pores). Instead, use plain yogurt or heavy cream.
Coffee grounds also help brighten up your skin and leave you feeling refreshed.

Ingredients: 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of virgin coconut oil and 2 tbsp (34 g) of brown sugar
How_to:
Mix 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of virgin coconut oil and 2 tbsp (34 g) of brown sugar. Scrub the mixture onto your face in small circular motions, then let it sit for about 5 to 10 minutes. Rinse your face with warm water and pat your skin dry with a towel.
Brown sugar is a physical exfoliant, so you won’t want to use this one more than once a week.
The coconut oil helps to rehydrate and moisturize your skin to leave it feeling fresh and glowy.
